questions.question: What percentage will Trump's new global tariffs be increased to?
questions.source_headline: Trump to hike global tariffs to 15% from 10%, 'effective immediately'
questions.explanation: The headline states Trump will increase global tariffs to 15% from the previous 10%.

questions.question: What is the FCC calling for in preparation for America's 250th anniversary?
questions.source_headline: FCC calls for more 'patriotic, pro-America' programming in runup to 250th anniversary
questions.explanation: The FCC specifically wants more patriotic, pro-America programming for the milestone anniversary.

questions.question: True or False: NASA's Artemis II lunar mission is definitely launching in March.
questions.source_headline: NASA's Artemis II lunar mission may not launch in March after all
questions.explanation: The headline says the mission 'may not launch in March after all,' indicating it's uncertain, not definite.

questions.question: In which state did the FBI investigate criminal damage to an ICE warehouse facility?
questions.source_headline: FBI investigates criminal damage to federal ICE warehouse facility in Arizona
questions.explanation: The headline specifically mentions the ICE warehouse facility is located in Arizona.

questions.question: How many prisoners are set for release under Venezuela's new amnesty law?
questions.source_headline: More than 1,500 prisoners set for release under Venezuela's new amnesty law
questions.explanation: The headline clearly states that more than 1,500 prisoners will be released under the new law.

questions.question: True or False: Tech giants are investing billions of dollars in Indian AI technology.
questions.source_headline: Tech giants commit billions to Indian AI as New Delhi pushes for superpower status
questions.explanation: The headline confirms that tech giants are committing billions to Indian AI development.

questions.question: Which country is mentioned in connection with a fishing festival?
questions.source_headline: Catch of the day: Pictures from spectacular Nigerian fishing festival
questions.explanation: The headline specifically mentions a Nigerian fishing festival.

questions.question: True or False: Australia's Prime Minister Albanese supports immigration cuts.
questions.source_headline: Australia PM Albanese rejects immigration cuts as far-right grows
questions.explanation: The headline states that PM Albanese 'rejects' immigration cuts, meaning he does not support them.

questions.question: Which company reclaimed the top spot in the global DRAM market in Q4?
questions.source_headline: Samsung reclaims top spot in global DRAM market in Q4
questions.explanation: Samsung is specifically named as reclaiming the top position in the global DRAM market.

questions.question: True or False: More than 3,000 people marched in France to honor a far-right activist.
questions.source_headline: Over 3,000 people march in France in honour of far-right activist
questions.explanation: The headline confirms that over 3,000 people participated in the march in France.
